articles.title: Leah R. Koenig
articles.contents:
Leah R. Koenig, MSPH
          
          
          CV

              Leah R. Koenig
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am a PhD candidate in Epidemiology and Translational
            Sciences at the University of California, San Francisco. I’m
            a member of the Advancing
            New Standards in Reproductive Health team at UCSF. I
            apply quantitative research methods to policy-relevant
            issues in reproductive health. My current research examines
            the safety, effectiveness, patient experience, and health
            equity implications of novel methods of abortion care.
            Education
            University of California, San Francisco
            | Ph.D. in Epidemiology and Translational Sciences |
            Expected 2024
            NIH Predoctoral F31 and T32 Fellow
            Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public
            Health | M.S.P.H in Population, Family, and
            Reproductive Health | May 2017
            Wesleyan University | B.A. with Honors
            in Social Studies | May 2013
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Leah R. Koenig

              Media
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            2024
            
            
            New York Times, “Abortions by Telemedicine
            and Mailed Pills Are Safe and Effective, Study Finds”
            
            Stat
            News, “Abortion pills offered via telehealth as
            safe as in-person medication abortions, study finds” 
            
            2023
            
            Mother
            Jones, “A New Study on Medication Abortion Refutes
            the Arguments Conservatives Are Taking to the Supreme
            Court”
            
            States Newsroom, “Abortion rights advocates
            say consequences dire if SCOTUS declines to hear pill
            case”
            
            High Country News, “Navigating the new
            healthcare deserts: Post-Roe, startups help those seeking
            abortion shrink travel distances and carbon
            emissions”
            New
            York Times, “Are Abortion Pills Safe? Here’s the
            Evidence.”
            
            MSNBC, Morning Joe, “How the COVID pandemic
            impacted family planning”
            Forbes,
            “Women less keen to get pregnant since the pandemic began,
            new study shows”

             Book chapters 
            
            Koenig LR, Li M. Achieving Gender Equality:
            Understanding Gender Equality and Health among Vulnerable
            Adolescents in the Sustainable Development Goals Era. In P.
            Banati, editor, Sustainable Development Across the Life
            Course: Evidence from Longitudinal Research. 2020. Bristol
            University Press.
            
             Reports and Opinion Editorials 
            
            
            Koenig LR, Upadhyay UD. Telehealth makes
            timely abortions possible for many, research shows. The
            Conversation. 2024.  
            Koenig
            LR, Becker A, Upadhyay UD. Telehealth medication
            abortion is safe and effective. Society of Family Planning.
            2023.

            LR, Upadhyay UD. Virtual Clinics Offer Safe and
            Effective Abortion Care. Public Health Post. 2021.  
            Zia
            Y, Koenig LR, Ko J, Upadhyay U. Safety and
            effectiveness of first-trimester medication abortion in the
            United States. Oakland, California: Advancing New Standards
            in Reproductive Health.

            2024
            
            Koenig LR, Ko J, Valladares E, Coeytaux F,
            Wells E, Lyles C, Upadhyay UD. Patient Acceptability of
            Telehealth Medication Abortion Care in the United States,
            2021‒2022: A Cohort Study. Am J Public Health.
            2024;114(2):241-250. (Altmetric Score: 138, top 5% of
            publications)
            Upadhyay UD, Koenig LR, Ko J, Valladares E,
            Meckstroth K, Biggs A. Effectiveness and safety of
            telehealth medication abortion in the United States. Nature
            Medicine. 2024;30(4):1191–8. (Altmetric Score: 2377, top
            1% of publications)

            JMIR Public Health Surveill. 2023;9:e45671. (Altmetric
            Score: 95, top 5% of publications)Koenig LR, Raymond EG, Gold M, Kaneshiro B,
            Winikoff B, Coplon L, Upadhyay UD. Mailing abortion pills
            does not delay care: a cohort study comparing mailed to
            in-person dispensing of abortion medications in the United
            States. Contraception. 2023:109962.Raymond
            E, Weaver M, Shochet T, Grant M, Boyd K, Koenig
            LR, Upadhyay UD. Clinical outcomes of medication
            abortion using misoprostol-only: a retrospective chart
            review at one clinic in the United States. Contraception,
            2023:110109.
            Gayles J, Barker K, Yahner M, Lundgren R, Li M,
            Koenig LR, Mafuta E, Mbela P, Moreau C.
            Balancing quality, intensity and scalability: Results of a
            multi-level sexual and reproductive health intervention for
            very young adolescents in Kinshasa. Journal of Adolescent
            Health. 2023;73(1S):S33-S42.
            
            2022
            
            
            Koenig LR, Smith Hughes C, Gemmill A,
            Diamond-Smith N. Unequal impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on

            cohort in the United States. Social Science and Medicine -
            Population Health. 2022:101305.
            Upadhyay UD, Raymond EG, Koenig LR, Coplon
            L, Gold M, Kaneshiro B, Boraas CM, Winikoff B. Outcomes and
            safety of history-based screening for medication abortion: a
            retrospective multicenter cohort study. JAMA Intern Med.
            2022 May 1;182(5):482. (Altmetric Score: 1320, top 5% of
            publications)
            
            2021
            
            
            Upadhyay UD, Koenig LR, Meckstroth K.
            Safety and efficacy of telehealth medication abortions in
            the US during the COVID-19 pandemic. JAMA Network Open.
            2021;4(8):e2122320–e2122320. (Altmetric Score: 1296, top 5%
            of publications)Koenig
            LR, Blum R, Shervington D, Green J, Li M, Wilopo S,
            Tabana H, Moreau C. Unequal gender norms are related to
            symptoms of depression among young adolescents: A
            cross-sectional, cross-cultural study. Journal of Adolescent
            Health. 2021;69(1):S47–55.
            Koenig LR*, Zimmerman L, Pulerwitz J,
            Kayembe P, Maddaleno M, Moreau C. The Intersection of Power
            and Gender: Examining the Relationship of Empowerment and
            Gender-Unequal Norms Among Young Adolescents in Kinshasa,
            DRC Journal of Adolescent Health. 2021;69(1):S64–71.
            Mmari K, Cooper D, Moreau C, Koenig LR,
            Martinez M, Mafuta E, Kayembe P, de Meyer S, Michielsen K,
            Yu C, Zuo X, Blum R. The social context of early adolescents
            in the Global Early Adolescent Study. Journal of Adolescent
            Health. 2021;69(1):S5–15.
            
            2020
            
            
            Koenig LR, Li M, Zimmerman LA, Kayembe P,
            Lou C, Mafuta E, Ortiz J, Moreau C. Associations between
            agency and sexual and reproductive health communication in
            early adolescence: a cross-cultural, cross-sectional study.
            Journal of Adolescent Health. 2020;67(3):416–24.
            
            2016
            
            
            Dabash R, Shochet T, Hajri S, Chelli H, Hassairi AE, Haleb
            D, Labassi H, Sfar E, Koenig LR, Winikoff
            B. Self-administered multi-level pregnancy tests in
            simplified follow-up of medical abortion in Tunisia. BMC
            Women’s Health. 2016;16(1):49.
            
            Manuscripts Under Review
            
            Koenig
            LR, Ko J, Upadhyay UD. Virtual clinic telehealth
            abortion services in the United States one year after Dobbs:
            a landscape review.(Preprint)
            Becker A, Doria C, Koenig LR, Ko J,
            Upadhyay UD. “It was so easy in a situation that’s so hard”:
            how telehealth mitigates abortion stigma.
            Doria C, Becker A, Koenig LR, Ko J,
            Upadhyay UD. “I don’t want to be in the energy of that
            situation”: Embodied experiences with telehealth medication
            abortion.
            Shin L, Koenig LR, Ko J, Meckstroth K,
            Upadhyay UD. Patient uptake of Rh testing and Rh
            immunoglobulin with telehealth medication abortion.
            Pacca L, Dang KV, Koenig LR, Gaye A, Duarte
            C, Harrati A, Vable AM. Sequence analysis as an approach to
            characterize variables that unfold over time: implementation
            and practical considerations for epidemiologists.
            
            Manuscripts In Preparation 
            Koenig LR, Raymond EG, Frye LJ, Glidden D,
            Kaneshiro B, Upadhyay UD. Comparing the safety and
            effectiveness of medication abortion provided with and
            without screening ultrasound or pelvic exam. Koenig LR, Upadhyay UD. Masculinity
            ideology increases sexual risk behaviors among adolescents
            and young adults. Koenig LR, Glidden D, Ko J, Upadhyay UD.
            Improving estimates of medication abortion effectiveness:
            The impact of loss to follow-up.Koenig LR, Pacca L, Hamad R, Holt K, Vable
            A. Exploring U.S. state abortion policy trajectories from
            1970 – 2014 using sequence analysis.Koenig LR, Pacca L, Diamond-Smith N, Vable
            A. Examining 24-month contraceptive use trajectories in the
            United States, a cohort study, 2018-2022
            Whitfield B, Koenig LR, Rocca C. Who
            switches from hormonal to non-hormonal contraception? A
            departure from typical explorations of uptake in highly
            effective contraception.
            Upadhyay UD, Koenig LR, Ko J, Sietstra C,
            Biggs A. Interest in late period pills in the United States:
            a nationally representative survey.
            Phillips K, Koenig LR, Peters L, Ko J,
            Upadhyay UD. Adolescent experiences using telehealth
            medication abortion in the United States. 
            Wilson ST, Peters L, Koenig LR, Bell SO,
            Upadhyay UD. Use of ultrasound before telehealth abortion.
            
            Biggs MA, Kaller S, Grossman D, Ko J, Koenig
            LR, Upadhyay UD. Experiences of ectopic pregnancy
            among people seeking telehealth abortion care.
